intro: Simpliglottis valida, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family, which includes many bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It features showy, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in late summer. The leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and often have a hairy texture.
